title: Stan ‘Tiny’ Hill, formidable rugby player who was once dropped by the All Blacks for being ‘too physical’ – obituary
text:
Stan “Tiny” Hill, who has died aged 92, was one of the toughest All Blacks of his era, and was once dropped from the side for being “too physical” when he knocked out a South African opponent; when New Zealand lost the next Test match, he was swiftly restored to the team and his abrasiveness helped them to win the series.

He played 19 times for the All Blacks as a lock or flanker, 11 of them in Tests, between 1955 and 1959, and captained his country twice. He took part in series victories over the touring Springboks in 1956 and the British and Irish Lions in 1959.

Tiny Hill’s standing was such that the current New Zealand team at the Rugby World Cup in Japan wore black armbands in his memory...
